{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3242658,"name":"Asher Leavitt","username":"Asher-Leavitt","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asher-leavitt/{size}/196239_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-19T00:34:51.583Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Our team is starting swerve for our preseason project and we wanted to try and test it using a physics simulation using the PyFRC API. I have tried (in vain) to use the pyfrc.physics.drivetrains.four_motor_swerve_drivetrain. We are currenly hoping to test our autos (some move just 2 motors while other attempt to move 4 modules) but are unable to see any motor/position output from the sim. We are wondering if anyone can help with any form of simulation as the documentation is quite minimal (bare minimum, 8 motors that have position outputs on the sim or a full swerve robot). All help is greatly appreciated.

code is here
my attempt at physics is under the physics branch

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-10-19T00:34:51.583Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":44,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":245.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":442705,"topic_slug":"python-pyfrc-swerve-simluation","display_username":"Asher Leavitt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Team4169/Swerve2024/tree/physics","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - Team4169/Swerve2024 at physics","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51018,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/python-pyfrc-swerve-simluation/442705/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3242668,"name":"Davo","username":"auscompgeek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/auscompgeek/{size}/9867_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-19T01:14:50.755Z","cooked":"

Your physics is trying to read the PWM outputs, when it looks like you’re using Spark MAX over CAN. You need to use DeviceSim to read the simulated Spark MAX output.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-10-19T01:14:50.755Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":27.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":442705,"topic_slug":"python-pyfrc-swerve-simluation","display_username":"Davo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI"},"post_url":"/t/python-pyfrc-swerve-simluation/442705/2","custom_user_title":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3243703,"name":"Asher Leavitt","username":"Asher-Leavitt","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asher-leavitt/{size}/196239_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-21T20:53:13.913Z","cooked":"

I tried to make the changes you described here (the file is called nope because I found that the physics.py file didn’t allow any auto code to be run). I’m really just trying to test move2motors and move1module auto commands to see if they’re giving position outputs. Having a swerve simulation would be nice but not needed. I really just want to see the position value changing in the sim. How might that be done?

image378×508 45.3 KB

Additionally, if you do have any tips for getting a the four_motor_swerve_drivetrain to simulate on the feild that would be a great help.

Thanks for your help!

You’re not seeing the simulated position value change because your physics code never updates it.

My team roughly simulated an arm extension using a Spark MAX, if it helps: https://github.com/thedropbears/pychargedup/blob/main/physics.py
